definition: to open ballot boxes/to count votes/to make out a voucher or invoice etc/to write out a receipt

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: In this as cashier and Invoice Rapporteur.
sentences.chinese: 在此擔任出納兼開票員一職。

sentences.english: For example, what are the planned payment and billing models?
sentences.chinese: 例如，什麼是計劃付款和開票模型？

sentences.english: The drawer of the cheque can stop a cheque within 24 hours after the cheque is drawn.
sentences.chinese: 支票開出後，開票人可以在二十四小時內止付。

definition: to buy tickets/(Tw) to buy votes (in an election)
the number of showings of a movie, play etc/screening/performance
(of a sports competition or match) to commence/(of a war or battle) to break out/to perform acrobatic or choreographed fighting (in Chinese opera)/to brawl/to come to blows
World Exposition/abbr. for 世界博覽會|世界博览会[Shi4 jie4 Bo2 lan3 hui4], World Expo
to beat the gong to open a performance
